sources.title: 1969 - Boot Hill - Terence Hill and Bud Spencer in a stunt-packed western film
sources.description:
Scruffy gunfighter Cat Stevens (Terence Hill) and his king-size sidekick Hutch Bessy (Bud Spencer) tumble into a corrupt frontier town of Escondido, where a crooked magnate calls the shots‚Äîuntil circus acrobats, a reluctant gunslinger, and a wandering gambler flip the script. Saddle up for a nimble, high-flying showdown where guts, grit, and trapeze tricks outmaneuver brute force.

Original Title: La collina degli stivali (1969) | AKA: Boot Hill, The Trinity Without Boots, Trinity Rides Again

‚≠êÔ∏è STARRING

George Eastman - Baby Doll
Eduardo Ciannelli - Boone
Glauco Onorato - Finch
Alberto Dell'Acqua - Sam (storekeeper)
Nazzareno Zamperla - Charlie (Finch's goon)
Victor Buono - Honey Fisher
Lionel Stander - Mami

üé¨ CREW CREDITS
Directed & Written by Giuseppe Colizzi (Dio perdona‚Ä¶ Io no!, I quattro dell‚ÄôAve Maria)
Cinematography by Giuseppe Ruzzolini (The Red Desert, Teorema)
Music by Carlo Rustichelli (Divorce Italian Style, Seduced and Abandoned)

üéØ WHY WATCH?
A circus-powered Spaghetti Western where acrobatic mayhem meets frontier justice!
Genre blend: Banter-filled buddy energy + stylish euro-western swagger

metadata.Plot: Honey Fisher has become a powerful man in this small Western town that has grown up around gold-prospecting fields. Fisher and his gang have managed, through swindling, murder, and terror, to gain leases on the important gold-yielding land in the area. A state commissioner comes to town to review the leases, which are crucial to Fisher's power. Cat Stevens and Hutch Bessy join forces with circus performers and townsfolk led by Stevens' friend Finch to fight against Fisher and his henchmen.
metadata.Actors: Terence Hill, Bud Spencer, Woody Strode
